title: Fiat's latest French road trip faces another Macron-shaped blockade
text:
John Elkann is clearly a man who isn’t afraid of potholes. Or perhaps the Italian is just a secret Francophile. Having tried and failed to pull off a hugely complicated merger with Renault earlier this year, the scion of Fiat’s founding Agnelli family has dusted himself down and is now trying to hop into bed with France’s other big carmaker Peugeot, which owns the Vauxhall brand in the UK.

In some ways it’s a more compelling tie-up but probably only marginally less complicated. Both companies are sub-scale compared to the really big beasts Volkswagen and Toyota, and size is going to become increasingly important as the race towards electrification intensifies.

The car industry has been painfully...
description: John Elkann is clearly a man who isn’t afraid of potholes.
